Class Position

java.lang.Object
  roboRallyPackage.Position

@Value
public class Position
extends java.lang.Object

Class representing a position.

Version:
24 may 2012
Author:
Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven
Invariants:
  • A Position must have valid X coordinate
        canHaveAsXCoord(this.getCoordX())
  • A Position must have a valid Y coordinate
        canHavaAsYCoord(hits.getCoordY())

    Constructor Detail

    Position

    public Position(long coordX,
                long coordY)
    Initializes this new position with the given x and y coordinates.

    Parameters:
    coordX - The X coordinate for this new position.
    coordY - The Y coordinate for this new position.
    Effects:
  • The new X coordinate of this new position is equal to the given X coordinate if this is a valid coordinate.
        this.setCoordX(coordX)
  • The new Y coordinate of this new position is equal to the given Y coordinate if this is a valid coordinate.
        this.setCoordY(coordY)
    • Throws:
    IllegalPositionException - [CAN] When either the given X coordinate or the given Y coordinate is unvalid
        canHaveAsXCoordinate(coordX) || canHaveAsYCoordinate(coordY)
    Method Detail

    getCoordX

    @Basic
public long getCoordX()
    Returns the X coordinate (horizontal axis, starting from the left side of the board) of this position.

    canHaveAsXCoordinate

    public static final boolean canHaveAsXCoordinate(long coordX)
    Checks whether the given X coordinate is a valid X coordinate.

    Parameters:
    coordX - The X coordinate to be checked.
    Returns:
    False if the given X coordinate is negative.
        result != coordX < 0
    Returns:
    False if the given X coordinate is greater than the maximum width of all boards.
        result != coordX > Board.getMaxWidth()

    getCoordY

    @Basic
public long getCoordY()
    Returns the Y coordinate (vertical axis, starting from the upper side of the board) of this position.

    canHaveAsYCoordinate

    public static final boolean canHaveAsYCoordinate(long coordY)
    Checks whether the given Y coordinate is a valid Y coordinate.

    Parameters:
    coordY - The Y coordinate to be checked.
    Returns:
    False if the given Y coordinate is negative
        result != coordY < 0
    Returns:
    False if the given Y coordinate is greater than the maximum height of all boards.
        result != coordY > Board.getMaxHeight()

    isValidPosition

    public static final boolean isValidPosition(Position position)
    Checks whether the given position is a valid position.

    Parameters:
    position - The position to be checked.
    Effect:
    False if the given (x,y)-combination is not a valid position.
        result == ((position == null) && isValidPosition(position.getCoordX(), position.getCoordY()))
    Returns:
    True if the given position is null
        result == (position == null)

    isValidPosition

    public static final boolean isValidPosition(long coordX,
                                            long coordY)
    Checks whether the given (x,y)-combination is a valid position.

    Parameters:
    position - The position to be checked.
    Returns:
    False if the given X coordinate is not a valid X coordinate.
        result == canHaveAsXCoordinate(coordX)
    Returns:
    False if the given Y coordinate is not a valid Y coordinate.
        result == canHaveAsYCoordinate(coordY)

    getNeighbour

    public Position getNeighbour(Orientation orientation)
                      throws IllegalPositionException
    Returns the position that lies next to this position, given a certain orientation.

    Parameters:
    orientation - The direction where the returned position will lie, respectively to the current position (up, down,...)
    Returns:
    ...
        result == this.getNeighbourAt(orientation, 1)
    Throws:
    IllegalPositionException - [CAN] ...
        ! this.canHaveAsXCoordinate(this.getCoordX() + orientation.getRelativeMoveCoordinates()[0])
           || ! this.canHaveAsYCoordinate(this.getCoordY() + orientation.getRelativeMoveCoordinates()[1])

    getAllNeighbours

    public Position[] getAllNeighbours()
    Returns a list of positions that are neighbours of this position (this position is not includes in the list). If a neighbour of this position is no valid position (e.g. they fall off the board), it is not included in the list.

    Returns:
    A list of all valid neighbours of this position
        for each orientation in Orientation.values(): result.contains(this.getNeighbour(orientation))
         || ! this.isValidPosition(this.getNeighbour(orientation))

    getNeighbourAt

    public Position getNeighbourAt(Orientation orientation,
                               int steps)
                        throws IllegalPositionException
    Returns the position that lies a given steps from this position, given a certain orientation.

    Parameters:
    orientation - The direction where the returned position will lie, respectively to the current position (up, down,...)
    steps - The number of steps one has to take to reach this new position, starting from this position
    Returns:
    ...
        result == Position(this.getCoordX() + steps * orientation.getRelativeMoveCoordinates()[0],  this.getCoordY() + steps * orientation.getRelativeMoveCoordinates()[1]);
    Throws:
    IllegalPositionException - [CAN] ...
        ! this.canHaveAsXCoordinate(this.getCoordX() + steps * orientation.getRelativeMoveCoordinates()[0])
           || ! this.canHaveAsYCoordinate(this.getCoordY() + steps * orientation.getRelativeMoveCoordinates()[1])

    isPlacedAtOrientationOf

    public boolean isPlacedAtOrientationOf(Position other,
                                       Orientation orientation)
    Returns true if the other position lies on the same line as this position, given a certain orientation (referring to this position).

    Parameters:
    other - The other position.
    orientation - The direction where the other position may lie, respectively to the current position (up, down,...).
    Returns:
    ...
        for each i in 1..this.getManhattanDistance(other)
         if(getNeighbourAt(orientation, i).equals(other)) then result == true

    getManhattanDistance

    public long getManhattanDistance(Position other)
    Returns the ManhattanDistance between this position and another position.

    Parameters:
    other - The other position.
    Returns:
    ...
        result == Math.abs(this.getCoordX() - other.getCoordX()) + Math.abs(this.getCoordY() - other.getCoordY())
